MatPat went on to be a passive aggressive jerk to Pirate Games for being upset that he LITERALLY GAVE CREDIT FOR THEIR GAME TO SOMEONE ELSE. Apparently not understanding why they were so mad.

This, in turn, got Toby Fox himself involved. Who called out MatPat for being a jerk to a company that needed the exposure for THEIR OWN GAME more than him. This, of course, led to both Undertale and Heartbound fans calling for Matpat to apologize.

MatPat apologized.. For hearing that PirateSoftware was upset. And then went on to explain why everything that he did was not a bad thing. His condescending tone in doing so, caused fans of both games to then call for him to be cancelled.

In fact. Do me a favor.  This is #CancelEtika which people claimed was running rampant at the time.  Click on that hashtag. Tell me how viral that hashtag went. Tell me how many thousands of people were boycotting him.  spoiler: There were like two posts in there before today.

I thought it was obvious what Cancel culture entailed, but if this many people are aren't aware of what it is, then it's possible that MatPat is also woefully misinformed on the topic. Which is still bad, but not as bad as purposely twisting etika's situation

This shit got way longer than I wanted it too, but I'll explain cancel culture anyway, just for the sake of clarity. Cancel culture follows these steps.  1. A person with influence fucks up somehow  2. Someone witnesses the fuck up and tries to blow it up on social media.

They essentially try to ensure that they lose whatever influence they have and cannot make money anymore.  Etika's fanbase did not do that to him. And calling what happened to him cancel culture implies that they did.

3. the post blows up and gains traction. Now there's thousands of people demanding the person who fucked up pay retribution for what they did.  How do they do this? They try to get them deplatformed lessen their influence. They go after sponsors to cut off their revenue.

And this 100% happened to Etika.. But that isn't what cancel culture is. What is being described there falls under two things.  1. Ignorance. Mostly from his younger fans. Etika himself tried to tell people he wasn't mentally ill. His older fans saw through that due to him

Calmed down my anger over the situation and am willing to give Matpat the benefit of the doubt. Even if only slightly. I thought he did this deliberately, but having read a lot of comments on the subject, it seems that a lot of people are misinformed about what cancel culture is

the other category this falls under? Cyberbullying. People saw a guy acting irrationally and decided to mock him because their lives are hollow and they can only feel good when tearing someone else down. It's a huge problem in and of itself. But that isn't cancel culture.

putting himself in life threatening situations. His younger fans instantly believed him and embraced this meme persona, calling him a clown and egging him on. You can see this happening in real life during his altercation with a cop. His teenage fans kept egging him on.
To put into perspective what I've been reading, the people who agree with MatPat define cancel culture as follows:  "Calling someone a clown and a meme and making fun of them."

And while I'm angry and can't bring myself to forgive them, I do have to relent that they're teens and can't justify my anger fully. Teens are woefully misinformed on the topic of mental illness. Still pissed as hell at them though.

You can say whatever you want about his fanbase, but they stuck by him even when he himself tried to push them away. he insulted them, called them slurs and they still came back to him. How did they cancel him when they constantly jumped into his streams every time he put one up?
